replies.body: i really like this idea. its really neat (in my opinion) to hear the raw logic behind all of these changes that most people just say "herpdeherpdehurr, that's op"
I hate it when people only say 'herpdeherpdehurr'!

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you better stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized exactly what was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My Mother said to me- "Don't smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed and at 21 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because your post gave me cancer anyway. herpdeherpdehurr
I almost felt bad... until the end.
Best Troll this YEAR.

You mean best copy pasta right.. right.
It's 2014 and this is from like 2012, lol.
I agree; I really enjoyed the video.  While I don't always agree with Riot's balance decisions, it's great to see that they're putting a lot of thought into each decision that they make.

they used to do this before too. It was Phreak and Morello going over the patch notes and Morello explaining why they did the things they did.

Glad to see it come back. Now its fancier too.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TkdP-Xp0N6o Never forget. Between Morello's laugh at the very *idea* of Noct buffs that close to his release, and Tamat's reaction, this was THE best patch simply because of the video for it. XD
Nothing can replace the hole in my heart for Nika.
Agree :( I used to sit next to her back when we worked on contests together. So many fun times were had!
You guys should do a Reunion video =).
You did great :) looked good up there too
Never will it happen. I wish she could have kept doing those small but awesome vids.
{{champion:32}} Okay
{{champion:33}} OK
If you want to focus on ali support ONLY why not just give him a useful passive instead of cutting his already weak passive by half...
riot look at this plz
They just cut down the damage it dealt to monsters, not minions. That way he can't jungle, and skew the game with the worst level 2 gank in history.
No, all supports need passives that do dmg to minions. Doing uncontrollable dmg to minions is quintessential to the support role.
When did "The View" start talking about League? Someone get them some coffee cups that have water in them.
Coffee Cups: Done.

they arent finished rolling it yet
4.20 will only come out when they blaze it {{champion:63}} {{champion:63}} {{item:2009}}
I always go {{item:3068}} on {{champion:57}} to light them trees

Really liked this video. It was especially great with snoopeh their questioning some of the decisions as a pro player. He really stopped them hard when he asked about lucians range nerf and then they did their best to convince him it was for the better. It was a great discussion i hope to see more of these. Also Pudding did a great job.
Good, but not enough {{champion:17}} deaths. 8/10

+1, Now I can stare at something other than my Patch Progress bar.
{{item:2049}} {{item:2045}}
I dislike the Jungle Timers. I feel like they are making things just too obvious and easy now.

On the other hand, now there is no excuse for missing a return trip to dragon, as opposed to timing the camp in chat with timestamps and scrolling for 15 seconds past the pings and arguing of your team to find your timing. I personally like the concept behind jungle timers because it makes information already available to the players more accessible and convenient.
But Blakinola does the  TL;DR's already lol {{champion:236}}

I would actually like to see an additional professional player in there. The discussion from Riot's perspective is really interesting, but I also liked to hear what Snoopeh had to say. Then there would also be more parity between professional and designer points of view. :)

I really like the feature, would love to see more of them. And feel free to go longer. :P
Awesome AD changes But i think the {{item:3508}} is a little too expensive to be 3400 Gold. its not worth the Passive 2-8% mana
Blah blah {{champion:236}} is a beast blah {{item:3072}} is blood thirstier. Now to the *real* question: Where can I get that {{champion:32}} plush?
Does anyone else remember the patch preview??? What was wrong with that?
Nikasaur or riot

i feel like once you get all the champs and all the runes IP is useless and almost subtracts a part of the game once I acquired everything. I essentially have a growing savings account that i only use to buy new champs when they come out.  Once you get like 10000 or 20000 IP you should be able to trade it in for like 975 RP.  I'd play more.

I thoroughly enjoy hearing the different perspectives on the Patch Notes. All the more insightful to see Snoopeh play devil's advocate on a couple of the changes to answer some of my own questions. Good work Riot, I'm a fan.
Didn't they used to have something like this to introduce the patch?

yeah, the last one I remember they made changes to {{champion:72}}  and then I didnt see any further videos on any future patches. That was before they introduced {{champion:266}}, so it was a quite some time ago.
aka Patch Preview 2.0

ok the jungle timers are long overdue, but we still dont have friendly ult timers. id also like to see friendly summoners timers although thats a little less important. we need the ult timers at least. it takes time to type and ask how long til a teamates ult is back up and thats important information. looking at a timer makes the game flow much better, compared to taking time to type

Not a bad idea.

But there seems to be a ridiculous amount of people who do this, and not to mention, they do it with more depth.

Probably won't be my first go to, but still, good luck Riot.

Edit: What I do like about it, is the fact you get the team behind the changes involved.
